content:
Roadside attractions have made several changes to their inventory or product offerings in response to COVID-19, including:

1. Providing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): Many roadside attractions have added PPE such as masks and gloves to their inventory for both guests and staff.

2. Contactless payment options: Many attractions have added contactless payment options to minimize physical contact between guests and staff.

3. Social distancing measures: Roadside attractions have implemented social distancing measures by reducing capacity, adding signs, and markers to ensure guests maintain the recommended six feet distance.

4. Hand sanitizing stations: Attractions have added hand sanitizing stations in high-traffic areas such as entrance, rides, and attractions.

5. Enhanced cleaning protocols: Roadside attractions have enhanced cleaning protocols regularly to ensure a clean and hygienic environment for guests.

6. Virtual options: To help accommodate those who may be unable or unwilling to visit the attraction some roadside attractions have made parts of their offerings virtual. For instance, virtual tours, exhibitions, and events have been added.

Overall, many roadside attractions have made significant adjustments to their inventory or product offerings to ensure the health and safety of guests and staff amid the COVID-19 pandemic.
